summary.para: Frees memory that was allocated by the method.

param.name: guidRepresentation
param.para: GUID that was passed to the method.

param.name: pvRepresentation
param.para: Pointer to the buffer that was returned by the method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Gets the major type of the format.

param.name: pguidMajorType
param.para: Receives the major type GUID. The major type describes the broad category of the format, such as audio or video. For a list of possible values, see Major Media Types.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The major type is not set.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to getting the MF_MT_MAJOR_TYPE attribute from the media type.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Retrieves an alternative representation of the media type. Currently only the DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure is supported.

param.name: guidRepresentation
param.para: GUID that specifies the representation to retrieve. The following values are defined.

description.para: Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure. The method selects the most appropriate format structure (pbFormat).
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with an format structure.
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with a VIDEOINFOHEADER format structure.
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with a VIDEOINFOHEADER2 format structure.

param.name: ppvRepresentation
param.para: Receives a pointer to a structure that contains the representation. The method allocates the memory for the structure. The caller must release the memory by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The details of the media type do not match the requested representation.
The media type is not valid.
The media type does not support the requested representation.

remarks.para: If you request a specific format structure in the guidRepresentation parameter, such as VIDEOINFOHEADER, you might lose some of the format information.
You can also use the function to convert a Media Foundation media type into a DirectShow media type.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Queries whether the media type is a temporally compressed format.Temporal compression uses information from previously decoded samples when decompressing the current sample.

param.name: pfCompressed
param.para: Receives a Boolean value. The value is TRUE if the format uses temporal compression, or FALSE if the format does not use temporal compression.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method returns FALSE in pfCompressed if the media type's MF_MT_ALL_SAMPLES_INDEPENDENT attribute is TRUE. If the MF_MT_ALL_SAMPLES_INDEPENDENT attribute is FALSE or not set, the method returns TRUE.

If the method returns TRUE in pfCompressed, it is a hint that the format has temporal compression applied to it. If the method returns FALSE, the format does not use temporal compression, although it might use intra-frame compression.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Compares two media types and determines whether they are identical. If they are not identical, the method indicates how the two formats differ.

param.name: pIMediaType
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the media type to compare.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Receives a bitwise OR of zero or more flags, indicating the degree of similarity between the two media types. The following flags are defined.

description.para: The major types are the same. The major type is specified by the MF_MT_MAJOR_TYPE attribute.
The subtypes are the same, or neither media type has a subtype. The subtype is specified by the MF_MT_SUBTYPE attribute.

The attributes in one of the media types are a subset of the attributes in the other, and the values of these attributes match, excluding the value of the MF_MT_USER_DATA, MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MIN, and MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MAX attributes.

Specifically, the method takes the media type with the smaller number of attributes and checks whether each attribute from that type is present in the other media type and has the same value (not including MF_MT_USER_DATA, MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MIN, and MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MAX).
To perform other comparisons, use the method. For example, the Compare method can test for identical attributes, or test the intersection of the two attribute sets. For more information, see .
The user data is identical, or neither media type contains user data. User data is specified by the MF_MT_USER_DATA attribute.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The types are not equal. Examine the pdwFlags parameter to determine how the types differ.
One or both media types are invalid.

remarks.para: Both of the media types must have a major type, or the method returns E_INVALIDARG.
If the method succeeds and all of the comparison flags are set in pdwFlags, the return value is S_OK. If the method succeeds but one or more comparison flags are not set, the method returns S_FALSE.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Represents a description of a media format.

remarks.para: To create a new media type, call .
All of the information in a media type is stored as attributes. To clone a media type, call .
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.
